body:
**Is this a request for help?** 

No 

**Environment**:

master

**What happened**:

10 Conformance tests fail on local cluster.  Some may be `Conformance` but others should be triaged, relabeled, or fixed, or skipped for single nodes.

```

[Fail] [k8s.io] Port forwarding [k8s.io] With a server listening on localhost [k8s.io] that expects a client request [It] should support a client that connects, sends no data, and disconnects [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/portforward.go:296

[Fail] [k8s.io] SchedulerPredicates [Serial] [BeforeEach] validates that NodeSelector is respected if matching [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/scheduling/predicates.go:81

[Fail] [k8s.io] DNS [It] should provide DNS for the cluster [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/dns.go:230

[Fail] [k8s.io] Port forwarding [k8s.io] With a server listening on localhost [k8s.io] that expects no client request [It] should support a client that connects, sends data, and disconnects [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/portforward.go:246

[Fail] [k8s.io] Port forwarding [k8s.io] With a server listening on localhost [k8s.io] that expects a client request [It] should support a client that connects, sends data, and disconnects [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/portforward.go:357

[Fail] [k8s.io] SchedulerPredicates [Serial] [BeforeEach] validates resource limits of pods that are allowed to run [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/scheduling/predicates.go:81

[Fail] [k8s.io] DNS [It] should provide DNS for services [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/dns.go:230

[Fail] [k8s.io] HostPath [It] should give a volume the correct mode [Conformance] [Volume]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/pods.go:76

[Fail] [k8s.io] SchedulerPredicates [Serial] [BeforeEach] validates that NodeSelector is respected if not matching [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/scheduling/predicates.go:81

[Fail] [k8s.io] Kubectl client [k8s.io] Guestbook application [It] should create and stop a working application [Conformance]
/home/jayunit100/work/gopath/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/kubectl.go:1676

```


**What you expected to happen**:

Local clusters should pass `Conformance`.

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):

```
echo "{}" > /tmp/x

sudo local-up-cluster.sh

_output/bin/e2e.test --provider=local --ginkgo.focus="Conformance" --kubeconfig=/tmp/x --kubectl-path=./cluster/kubectl.sh
```

**Note**

By making sure a subset of E2E's pass on local clusters we gaurantee failure of E2E's on local clusters represent real flakes, thus allowing us to detect flakes before we put them into the code.
title: Triage, fix, or SkipIfNode<1 [Conformance] tests which don't work on local cluster.
